review: There are few "good" apps, all the decent movies cost over $6 to rent and the remote sticks when you use it. If more apps are added and the price of the movies go down it will be wonderful. By the statement of thousands of movies leaves us to believe free movies and not expensive movies. With the stick being fairly new it's good for what it is, time will make it better. author: David DeWitt

review: Excellent media device. I have already owned the Amazon Fire TV for a while, and once this came out, it was a no brainer to get the Fire stick. This allows me to view Amazon content, Netflix, etc on other TVs in my house, and is also portable if I ever decide to use it somewhere else. I think this is great for anybody, but if you're a prime use,r it's even better. You instantly have all of your Amazon content, music, photos, all connected to your media system.
author: Digitalmaster

review: Easy enough to set up.  However, in first 24 hours, it lost connectivity twice and had to be reset.  We watch a lot of IFC films (European, etc.) and often these are subtitled.  At least as far as the Netflix app on this goes, the subtitles are in black type which disappears almost entirely on any film which is not brightly lit.  The regular Netflix app on my Blue Ray DVD player and smart TV have subtitles whose type is bright white/yellow and visible under all circumstances.  I do not know if the type color can be corrected on this device or not.  This is one of two items which I am going to contact customer service about.  The second issue is that the volume from the device appears low.  For one movie we had to turn our TV volume to max in order to adequately hear the dialogue.  I am not sure if this was related again to a connectivity issue or not.  It should be noted that when the device was having connectivity issues, none of the other WiFi devices in our house had any issues.  The connectivity issue was strictly a Fire TV Stick issue.It does make using some apps easier, but the above problems make it a bit underwhelming at this point.  I will be interested to see what Customer Service has to offer.
